message: Has anyone had any luck finding someone that looks like "Cho" to use as a reference?
I think someone found the original actor, and they also got a book or something. But I don't know if those worked out or not.
Have you considered using photosynth to make some of these things easier?

I would imagine that any tool that automatically generates models from photos might let you zoom around the model for some cool times, but the output would be unacceptable for use in a video game. Besides, isn't Photosynth for stitching lots of photos into 3D panoramic views of scenes, not building detailed object models?
Well, you might be able to make a decent head texture from it. Although maybe photoshop's tool for that would be better.

To be clear, we're not using 3d.sk for anything but reference - the models are sculpted and painted by hand in Z-brush at insanely high poly counts, and then the textures are baked out to regular image maps for the low-poly models.
If you're making good progress on the character models, can you post some cutscenes, or are those going to be one of the wonderful surprises in beta?
Dear everyone: I have just realized that somehow I've managed to post 80 things on this group, so I hereby withdraw until someone surpasses me in the "scoring", so I can.. stay humble, I guess.
So then no luck on finding an actor to model after?
No, not as such, but it's also become much, much less important for us to find one. (btw, 3d.sk cost us money to get access to the photos - your donation dollars at work!)
